alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:18PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 318 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Cottonwood Visitor, or 12 miles north of Chiriaco Summit. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Desert Center, Cottonwood Visitor and Eagle Mtn. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 91 and 107. CA Route 177 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
